instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook AIr <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 11"

No 5V on DC-IN on pin 3 on J7000 (<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>) (edit: that's probably not right, misread the schematic)

Was already getting no voltage on pin 3 (J7000) before I fixed <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, which was shorted to ground by a blown capacitor, on the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> line.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: History? The basics? PPBUS, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>? PPVRTC? Green/orange light present?
